docs.lead_paragraph: Constance Carpenter, an actress whose roles included a starring performance opposite Yul Brynner in the original Broadway production of "The King and I," died on Saturday at Lenox Hill Hospital in Manhattan. She was 87 and lived in Manhattan. Miss Carpenter died of a stroke, said a friend, Rudy Toronto.

headline.main: Constance Carpenter, 87, Actress In 'The King and I' on Broadway

docs.snippet: The names on QUEEN ELIZABETH II's New Year's Honor List are familiar in many necks of the woods.  Among them: the Oscar-winning actor ANTHONY HOPKINS, the political interviewer DAVID FROST and SHIRLEY WILLIAMS, a former Labor Party cabinet ministe...
docs.lead_paragraph: The names on QUEEN ELIZABETH II's New Year's Honor List are familiar in many necks of the woods. Among them: the Oscar-winning actor ANTHONY HOPKINS, the political interviewer DAVID FROST and SHIRLEY WILLIAMS, a former Labor Party cabinet minister. "It's so exciting, the most wonderful surprise that I have ever had," Mr. Frost, 53, said by telephone from Yorkshire. He had been awarded an O.B.E., Officer of the British Empire, at age 30, "and I never expected knighthood."

keywords.name: persons
keywords.value: ELIZABETH II, QUEEN OF GREAT BRITAIN
